article.title: What Would a Graph Look Like in This Layout? A Machine Learning Approach to Large Graph Visualization

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of clustering graphs based on their topological similarities in this figure?
choices: To facilitate user study by grouping visually similar graphs.
To improve the accuracy of aesthetic metrics calculation.
To reduce the computation time of graph layout algorithms.
To demonstrate the effectiveness of t-SNE projection method.

multiple_choice_question.text: What layout algorithm is used to visualize the highlighted graphs in the figure?
choices: sfdp
FM³
FR
KK

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the pair of graphs within each highlighted box represent?
choices: Two isomorphic graphs with different visual representations.
Two most topologically similar but non-isomorphic graphs.
Two graphs with the highest and lowest aesthetic scores.
Two randomly selected graphs from the dataset.

multiple_choice_question.text: What kernel is used to measure the topological similarity between graphs in this figure?
choices: Cosine similarity kernel
Gaussian radial basis function kernel
RW-LOG-LAPLACIAN kernel
Deep Graphlet Kernel

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the figures in Figure 2 represent?
choices: Different types of graph layouts
Examples of isomorphic graphs
All connected graphlets of 3, 4, or 5 vertices
Subgraphs extracted using random vertex sampling

multiple_choice_question.text: How many connected graphlets are there with 4 vertices?
Why are graphlets useful in graph analysis?
choices: They can be used to visualize large graphs efficiently.
They provide information about the global structure of a graph.
They capture local structural patterns within a graph.
They can be used to determine the optimal layout for a graph.
Calculation of graph edit distance.
Definition of a kernel function.
Formula for aesthetic metric "crosslessness."
Computation of graphlet concentration.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does k(x,x\') represent in this formula?
choices: Distance between two data points in the input space.
Similarity measure between two data points x and x\'.
Transformation of data point x into a higher dimensional space.
Prediction of a target variable y for a given input x.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the feature map φ in this formula?
choices: It defines the similarity measure between data points.
It maps input data points into a higher dimensional feature space.
It calculates the inner product between two vectors.
It reduces the dimensionality of the input data.
